binary_object.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_BINARY_OBJECT_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_BINARY_OBJECT_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // nvp.hpp: interface for serialization system.
00011 
00012 // (C) Copyright 2002 Robert Ramey - http://www.rrsd.com . 
00013 // Use, modification and distribution is subject to the Boost Software
00014 // License, Version 1.0. (See accompanying file LICENSE_1_0.txt or copy at
00015 // http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
00016

00018 
00019 #include <cassert>
00020 
00021 #include <cstddef> // std::size_t
00022 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00023 #if defined(BOOST_NO_STDC_NAMESPACE)
00024 namespace std{ 
00025     using ::size_t; 
00026 } // namespace std
00027 #endif
00028 
00029 #include <boost/preprocessor/stringize.hpp>
00030 #include <boost/serialization/tracking.hpp>
00031 #include <boost/serialization/level.hpp>
00032 #include <boost/serialization/split_member.hpp>
00033 #include <boost/serialization/nvp.hpp>
00034 #include <boost/serialization/wrapper.hpp>
00035 
00036 namespace boost {
00037 namespace serialization {
00038 
00039 struct binary_object {
00040     /* const */ void * const m_t;
00041     const std::size_t m_size;
00042     template<class Archive>
00043     void save(Archive & ar, const unsigned int /* file_version */) const {
00044         ar.save_binary(m_t, m_size);
00045     }
00046     template<class Archive>
00047     void load(Archive & ar, const unsigned int /* file_version */) const {
00048         ar.load_binary(const_cast<void *>(m_t), m_size);
00049     }
00050     BOOST_SERIALIZATION_SPLIT_MEMBER()
00051     binary_object(/* const */ void * const t, std::size_t size) :
00052         m_t(t),
00053         m_size(size)
00054     {}
00055     binary_object(const binary_object & rhs) :
00056         m_t(rhs.m_t),
00057         m_size(rhs.m_size)
00058     {}
00059 };
00060 
00061 // just a little helper to support the convention that all serialization
00062 // wrappers follow the naming convention make_xxxxx
00063 inline 
00064 #ifndef BOOST_NO_FUNCTION_TEMPLATE_ORDERING
00065 const
00066 #endif
00067 binary_object 
00068 make_binary_object(/* const */ void * t, std::size_t size){
00069     return binary_object(t, size);
00070 }
00071 
00072 // this is a wrapper
00073 
00074 template <>
00075 struct is_wrapper<binary_object>
00076  : public mpl::true_
00077 {};
00078 
00079 } // namespace serialization
00080 } // boost
00081 
00082 // don't need versioning info for this type
00083 BOOST_CLASS_IMPLEMENTATION(
00084     binary_object, 
00085     boost::serialization::object_serializable
00086 )
00087 
00088 // don't track binary objects - usually they will be created on the stack
00089 // and tracking algorithm (which uses the object address) might get
00090 // confused.  note that these address will likely be members of some
00091 // other structure which itself is tracked, so as a practical matter
00092 // suppressing tracking shouldn't cause any redundancy.
00093 
00094 BOOST_CLASS_TRACKING(binary_object, boost::serialization::track_never) 
00095 
00096 #endif // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_BINARY_OBJECT_HPP
